column3: Can we snarf (some portion of) mouse movements via Qt directly (on all platforms)?

Concept ACK on removing this, especially as it's Windows only.\n\nBut it would be nice to use UI events in general and feed them into our own RNG (perhaps batches together when there are a bunch of events accumulated).
I think removing this (gui-only, windows-only) can be done independently from adding more randomness sources
> I think removing this (gui-only, windows-only) can be done independently from adding more randomness sources\n\nAgreed.

ACK cc3b5289ef648dca30469ee4afa615a1ed5b4e04

Maybe get rid of RAND_screen calls too. They've been [deprecated a while ago](https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.1.0/man3/RAND_screen.html).

> But it would be nice to use UI events in general and feed them into our own RNG (perhaps batches together when there are a bunch of events accumulated).

I'm not sure it's worth doing, especially wit

> the OS's randomness generation on modern OSes is supposed to take care of this. It has access to much more timings and such than a user-space application ever would.\n\nYes. Just for fun, no offence: Reminds me of https://flak.tedunangst.com/post/random-in-the-wild
